#Text=4. Magnetic-Map-Matching-Aided Pedestrian Dead Reckoning

#Text=In Section 3 , it is verified that the number of outliers is reduced , and the magnetic-map-matching accuracy is improved by employing multiple magnetic sensors and proposed mitigation techniques .
#Text=This section describes combining PDR and magnetic map matching .
#Text=By integrating them , it is expected that the positioning accuracy will be improved even when a magnetic map does not cover all the areas .
#Text=In this study , map-matching-aided pedestrian dead reckoning ( MAPDR ) was constructed .
#Text=To estimate and compensate for the navigation errors , a 15th-order EKF is used .

#Text=The error state vector is given by the following equation : ( 23 ) where , , and are the position error , velocity error , and attitude error in the North-East-Down ( NED ) coordinate system , respectively .
#Text=The gyro bias and acceleration bias are and , respectively .

#Text=Since the navigation sensors used in a PDR cannot measure the earth rate , the error models , including the position error , can be simplified as follows : ( 24 ) ( 25 ) ( 26 ) where is a rotation matrix from the body frame to NED frame , and is a skew-symmetric matrix corresponding to input acceleration which is defined as follows : ( 27 )
#Text=Thus , the 15th-order state-space-error model can be expressed as follows : ( 28 ) where is the input noise vector , and is an identity matrix .
#Text=The biases of the accelerometer and gyroscope sensors are assumed to be a first-order Markov process , with a large time constant to compensate the slowly varying bias drift over time .
#Text=Thus , and are set to be very small in this model .

#Text=In addition to the position measurements from magnetic map matching , the heading information using the magnetic sensor mounted on the waist is utilized as a measurement for preventing the divergence of the yaw angle .

#Text=While ZUPT is performed repeatedly in a stance phase , the magnetic heading update and position update are carried out once in the stance phase because they are relatively less accurate than the zero velocity measurements .
#Text=Therefore , two measurement models are required .
#Text=One is for the position and heading measurement update at the time when the stance phase starts , which is defined as follows : ( 29 )
#Text=In this case , the measurement becomes where is obtained by importance sampling and magnetic map matching , and is a heading measurement obtained from the waist-mounted magnetic sensor .

#Text=The measurement covariance matrix , for the measurements noise , , is composed of , which is automatically calculated by the importance sampling and , which represents the variance of the heading measurement .
#Text=Although the magnetic field around the waist is less distorted , the heading information is not sufficiently accurate .
#Text=Moreover , the position measurement can be used for the EKF , so that is set to a slightly large value .
#Text=The other measurement model is for ZUPT during the stance phase , which is expressed as follows : ( 30 ) where is the measured noise vector modeled as white Gaussian noise with covariance , .
#Text=The velocity measurement is , the and velocity measurement noise covariance is usually small when the stance phase can be detected perfectly .
#Text=Figure 7
#Text=shows a block diagram of the proposed MAPDR algorithm .

#Text=The MAPDR algorithm is roughly divided into three parts : an inertial navigation algorithm , a magnetic-field map-matching with outlier mitigation and importance sampling , and an extended Kalman filter .
#Text=Basically , attitude , velocity , and position are obtained through an inertial navigation process based on the quaternion .
#Text=The heading measurements from the magnetic sensor , the position measurement from the magnetic map matching , and the ZUPT are used for the EKF to correct navigation and sensor bias errors .
